content.detailedDescription: It is 4:50am now , i am finishing up listening to coast2coast a.M.,and went to check the front door ,turn off lights,etc.,when i here dogs barking,that all too familiar sound in their voice that i have become aware of when "ufo's" are near...So i stepped out the front door to the porch and listened closer to their barks,it wasn't my dogs but the neighbors' and yes they definitely had "that" tone to their barks ,so i stepped outside all the way to get a look at the sky,and sure enough,i see one right off the bat.(my dog was lying right in the front yard and was listening to the other dogs but not too worried since they aren't over "our" house this time.)so i go back in grab my binoculars and camera,and head back out.When i get out there i discover that there isn't one but two,the first one is farther off,maybe nearer to hwy 62,idk,and is flickering brilliantly the typical blues,reds,and yellowish whites,that we have seen out here before,yet lower and closer than most of those.It is over towards the n.E.,& higher altitude than the other,but stationary.Maybe about 65 or 70 degrees from horizon.The second one is more towards the e.,at an altitude not much higher than the neighbors pole light ,by 1 finger width,possibly at a 55 degree angle ,and is a bright yellowish/white light very bright,as bright as the pole light in front of it ,but slightly smaller .(the pole light from my house is approx. the size of a softball,but up close more the size of a grapefruit ,and the ufo light was approx. the size of a baseball in comparison.)also stationary,and when looked at through the binocs.,appears as a disk shaped object, on it's end.And much closer than the other,in the binocs. it is very clear to see.So,i go back in after attempting to take some pics.,which i don't think will turn out due to it being so dark,and woke my teen daughter to come look.When we get back outside,they both appear to be in the same place as before,until we look through binocs. again and this time the second,closer one is on a slant more diagonally instead of on it's end ,like before. but both look to her the same as they do to me through the binocs.,as i had her describe to me what she was seeing.They are still there as i report this,and i'd expect like before they shall remain there for awhile.We hadn't seen any for a month or so now,and today is my birthday ,so what a treat for me!!! these things are amazingly beautiful,and even though we are a bit leery of them ,we are not really afraid anymore,and i'd love to see another up close view...You can tell my areas investigators that they're heeerre again.:)i'm going back out for another look before bed and will be listening for my dog to have "that" tone to his bark...I have just went back out to look again ,it is now 5:11a.M. and they are still approx. the same distance from each other but have both moved to the right,meaning the multi-colored one is now over near the neighbors pole light and the larger whitish light is almost over top of our road,if i had to est. the distance moved i would say,using my arm,it is from elbow to finger tip length.(no way they are planets,stars, or satellites either,imo.)
content.summary: Over harrison co. again!

content.detailedDescription: While waiting to see a fireworks display at a distance of about 1-1.5 miles away at the oregon ridge park , myself and my group of 6 adults 5 children witnessed a glowing orange orb . i noticed it approaching from the southeast at about 1-2 thousand feet in altitude. my first thought was that these were the lights of an approaching helicopter or a small plane, a bright orange round light that apeared to be glowing when directly overhead. the skies were mostly cloudy, so i figured that was why i couldn't see any blinking lights, until it flew silently overhead and had the immediate thought that this was not a plane or helicopter. before it flew directly overhead i announced the strange object to the group, everyone took notice and assumed that it was an aircraft of some kind , but also verbalized that it was odd and silent. i as two others in the group observed it closely as it passed overhead in a sort of wonderment as to what we could be seeing , it kept a steady speed as it moved away to the northwest, the light faded out but the object was still visible for a minute . at this point i and two others of the group were intrigued but resumed our conversations, games w/ kids etc. please note that we were a group of 12 sitting in a grassy knoll at a parking lot , on top of a hill , directly west of interstate i83, there were approx 400 people taking advantage of this vantage point to see a local fireworks display. about 30 minutes later while there was still some light in the sky the object appeared from the same direction and floated overhead as before. upon this second sighting it was clear and evident that this was not a plane or helicopter , just a glowing orange sphere that made no audble noise. as a person who is familiar with the ufo phenomenon, i am extra careful to label something as a ufo , this was so odd that i am perplexed and felt obliged to make a report.
content.summary: Glowing sphere floated directly overhead and away before fading out , twice!

content.detailedDescription: During the fireworks, 7 fireballs flew across the sky, 1 at a time, a few minutes apart. they were orangy/red/yellowish and no tails.  they faded to black.  they appeared to travel northwest to south east===location, long island, ny.  they only flew during the fireworks.  i was hoping it was just a meteor shower, but unsure that it was.  they made me a little nervous.  i never saw anything like that.
content.summary: 7 orange fireballs flew across the sky and faded to black.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting outside observing the full moon rising up just over my home,when i noticed a bright light.It was about the size of a quarter if held at arms length.Bright star like moving slowly north/north east,there were clouds moving through but mostly clear.I observed this for maybe about 2 min as it got further away it just dissapeared.It made no sound as it passed over and had no blinking lights,just a solid bright star like object.I thought maybe it was a weather balloon but this was just way to bright it seemed.I have observed these before but never so close as this was and what really got me is that it just dissapeared right before my eyes.
content.summary: Bright star like object.

content.detailedDescription:
el cajon, san diego ~ backyard ~ about 9 p.M. ~ waiting for fireworks
 i first noticed one bright red light coming from the north heading southeast, thinking i was getting to see a satellite/space station/weather ballon.  what startled me was watching 2-3 other red lights approach from the south and form an open triangle and hover.  the 3 lights then seemed to follow the larger, bright red light towards the east, moving very slowly, and then disappearing from my sight. 
     i still think these possibly might be experimental helicopter/hovercraft, that can fly at slow speeds.  nightime skies make it difficult to estimate depth/size of objects.  would be a nice annual gimmick to pull off if possible!  seems like it is.
content.summary: Multiple red lights moving slowly in the eastern sky.

content.detailedDescription:
My family and neighbors were in my front yard watching fireworks that i was lighting.  the police department showed up and i went to the end of the driveway to talk to them.  they left a few minutes later and we were all standing in my front yard when one of my neighbors pointed towards the north in the sky and said "look at the orange glow".  it moved from the northwest, behind my house going towards the south.  it appeared to be below cloud level, this was hard to tell since it was a very clear night with only one or two small clouds in the sky but the moon was shining very bright.  

the orange orb moved at a speed that i have only seen from watching the international space station go by.  this orb made no noise at all.  the orb was glowing an orange but not flashing.  there were no flashing lights on it at all like you see on airplanes.  i was in the navy for 4 years and have seen helicopters, jets, etc. all fly at night and this orange orb is something of its own.

there were 8 adults and 6 children that all witnessed this.
content.summary: Orange orb

content.detailedDescription: At 2245, 7-6-2009.  i was working as a security supervisor at a major sports uniform manufacturer and i was on interior patrol and part of my patrols is open several exit doors, when i opened one of the doors i saw a star like object that looked like the north star but it was larger. not thinking anything of it, i blew it off. i looked at the "star" again and noticed it was moving from wsw towards the ene. at arms length, the objects size was about the size of a pea and it was about 2000 feet up, i first thought it was a plane approaching the indianapolis international airport, but, the was no flashing lights or sound. it was just a light & i watched it for about 2.5 minutes before it disappeared behind another building.
content.summary: It was about the size of a pea at arms length.

content.detailedDescription:
Approximately 20-30 people remained at my in-laws july 4th party. some were swimming, others sitting around enjoying the fireworks from all of the surrounding homes. 

suddenly one of the kids said, "hey! what is that?" everyone outside and inside the home were facing north at the time. i believe all attendees at the party witnessed what the child pointed at. 

five to six orange balls floated about in the distant sky (approximately a quarter of a mile away and about 500-600 feet above the terrain). these glowing orbs seemed to move with a type of intent or purpose outlining geometrical shapes, triangles, semi-circles, etc. 

after much discussion we collectively ruled out fireworks due to the nature and behavior of the objects. (fireworks do not hang suspended for extended periods of time, fly in suspended formations both rising and falling, rising again, and then slowly shrink out of existence.)   

the predominate feeling discussed by all was one of wonder and curiosity. though one or two children did get quite scared. this was compounded on our trip home by an intense, blinding fog. 

quite sorry that we did not get any pictures or videos but typically none of us ever have brought any cameras to our celebrations save for anniversaries, weddings, etc..
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Ufo event precisely like those from 7-4-09 reports, orange fireballs moving in tandem.

content.detailedDescription: I along with seven other adult family members observed an amber, glowing light in the sky.  unbeknownst to us, the fireworks display we were waiting on had been cancelled due to rain that ended around 21:00.  as we waited, and watched to the south for the show to begin, we observed this object just appear out of no where at altitude.  i would estimate that the object was travelling on an estimated course of 310 - 320 deg. from the south at a speed of 40 -50 kts.  altitude could be estimated at 2k - 3k feet.  what little twilight remained suggested that the wind was calm from the east with maybe 40% broken clouds.  interstingly, we could hear others on the lake making the same observation.  as the object came closer, the amber light appeared to flicker, and it's possible that it had more than just one light.  the object displayed no nav, beacon or landing/taxi lights and made no sound as it approached and passed.  after it passed overhead, it continued for a short distance then slowly turned west (maybe to 290 deg.) until it disappeared behind some clouds.  strange. best explained as a balloon, comical paraglider or a really quiet helo from grissom afb?  really strange?  this happened again approximately 10-12 minutes later.  same course, altitude, speed, etc. a replay of sorts.  again?  yes! another 10-12 minutes later, same as before.  only notable difference was that the object turned earlier than before on the final pass.  we all shrugged and joked that we had all witnessed our first ufo.  we are all skeptical, but very curious for an explanation.  i am sure that dozens of others on the lake observed this display.  what better time to announce your presence than the only night of the year when so many are watching the sky?
content.summary: Observed amber, glowing light move precisely across the sky and disappear three times in 35 minutes.

content.detailedDescription:
This event came to the attention of sd from a newspaper artical sent to him via email and then forwarded to ssd/fi to verify and follow up.
the following is from phone interview with the witness.

at 3:56am est the witness went to lock the front door when she looked out the door window and saw a bright light across the street,to the side of a building,up above it approximately 40-50feet,and within 500' from her house in the s.E.The object/light remained stationary and hoovering. the witness watched as it changed color from red to green to white.It would completely fade out and then reappear about every 2 minutes.The shape was unknown only the bright light could be seen.The witness became frightened and called the police.She watched the object/light for approximately 1 hour and got too tired watching and waiting for police and she went to bed.The object/light was still in the same place still in the s.E.
content.summary: Bright red, green and white light that would fade out and then reappear.

content.detailedDescription: I am a graduate student at eastern new mexico university, studying archaeology.  my fiance, two friends and me were all outside talking around our fire pit, in our backyard from about 7pm to 11:30pm.  cannon airforce base is 17 miles north of us, and has recently upgraded to a special-ops base. because of this, planes are once again doing maneuvers over portales.  we are used to seeing low-flying planes.  on a normal night, here, we can watch the skies and spot between 5 - 8 satellites over the course of the night.  on this particular night, satellite activity increased exponentially.  we spoted around 20 satellites within an hour to an hour and a half.  we saw two shooting stars, and watched high as well as low altitude planes flying by.  there were four of us and what we saw we can each individually confirm.  my chair was facing north/northeast and i saw a brighter than usual light in the sky.  i yelled for everyone to look, in the initial excitment thinking at first it was a shooting star.  when everyone found the object in the sky, we were all mesmerized.  it was not a shooting star.  it kept it's speed(extremely fast) and its luminescence did not waiver.  it was boomerang in shape and the color was a grey to green resembling the toy glow-in-the-dark stars that are put on kids ceilings.  the object was moving north/northwest, directly toward cannon airforce base.  this was not a plane.  there were no lights on the object, just the eery glow green color.  there was also no sound.  the object was flying so fast, and so low that there should have been an audible sound for propulsion device.  it also appeared to move a nearby cloud as it passed in the distance.  the object moved in a straight line.  it never slowed and seemed to maintain a direct course.  once it had passed a feeling of extreme nausia took over, and a period of nervous anxiety seemed to replace the feeling of the peaceful evening.  all four of us saw the object and watched it fly over and continue flying out of sight.
content.summary: Bioluminescence; boomerang shape; solid glow, no differentiated lights, extremely fast speed; no sound.

content.detailedDescription: I decided to go outside in front of my house after hearing a lot of fireworks going on outside, i decided to go get my camera to take photos of them because i wanted to send them to my kids in florida. after looking to the sky to see the fireworks i noticed the sky was bountiful because the sun was going down. i shot two or three photos and looked at them but i did not noticed nothing out of the ordinary. i kept shooting more. after about an hour and a half i decided to go inside and transfer them to my computer. and that's when i noticed these circles, the faded ones did not surprised me much but the clear blue one did.After that i made sure the lens from the camera was clean, thinking that maybe that could have been the problem but even after i wipe the lens i decided to shot more photos outside, by that time it was dark outside and there was no fireworks been shot. i shot more photos and the circle appeared again but this time it was real bright, and this last time i shot i pointed my camera towards a different direction to the sky. i would like someone to tell me what this could be. could this be a reflection of some sort or what? thank you in advance
content.summary: A blue sphere apeared in the photo on the sky even though i didn't see it with just by looking at the sky.

content.detailedDescription: At 2:30 am on july 5th i was driving east on holdrege street stopped at traffic light to turn north on 56th street street. looked to my left to make the turn and noticed a brilliant red light to the northeast. i made the turn north and pulled on to a side street one block after turning. the light was a red/orange triangular shape with an orange "doughnut" halo around it. the light although very bright did not emit a glow as would a street light. the object was moving at a steady pace, but much slower than an air plane, to the south west. as the object passed over me it slowed down and came to a stop for about 30 seconds then moved on again to the s.W. it flew for about a few blocks and again stopped for about 15 seconds then climbed higher in altitude and vanished. the object did not have any blinking lights and was completely silent. i would guess the altitude to be about 500 feet. the entire event lasted about 3 minutes in which time i was able to get many photographs of it.
content.summary: Red triangle shaped light with orange halo.

content.detailedDescription: My family and i were at a fourth of july party with family and friends talking and enjoying the fireworks, when my fiance' saw something in the sky.  we all looked up and saw two orange glowing spheres flying very slowly going from north to south.  they flew in a general straight path that wavered somewhat as they moved slightly up and down while moving.  this lasted about 45 seconds to one minute before they both just faded away one after another.  they were bright and very distinct. if i held something up in the air at arm's length it would be about the size of a pea. we were all amazed at what we saw. there were about 35 people that witnessed this. i'm still stunned from this event. they spheres did not act like a plane or helicopter. i called this in to margie kay at kansas city mufon and she said to file a report.
content.summary: Two glowing orange spheres moving south in a straight pattern, one following the other. one faded out , then the other.

content.detailedDescription: I have just recently purchased night vision monocular and thought i would try it out on the night sky.I had been looking up close to the plough when i saw 4 bright orbs moving along the night sky,at first i though i was cloud movement but the 4 objects moved out of my field of view and seemed to be very high and moving fast.All of a sudden the light broke formation and 2 of them were circling the other 2.Then the other 2 moved behind the first 2 and they formed a line and moved away in the night sky at a speed faster than a sattelite moves,i called my wife but by the time she came out of our house they had gone.We continued to watch the sky for about 10 minutes when we both saw a very bright light (orb moving accross the sky at a very fast speed,. there was no way this was a plane or sattelite and we heard no noise at all.My wife was astounded at what we both had just seen together without night vision.The area that we live is very quiet relating to commercial airlines and we can always distinguish planes or helicopters by the noise and lights they emit.I just wish i had time to have got my camera to capture the single ufo on film.I dont think i would have been able to capture the first objects on film as they were a lot higher and only visible using night vision.
content.summary: Just got my night vision today tried it out and after about 20 minutes i could not believe what i saw.

content.detailedDescription: I was leaving for work and saw this fireball in the sky. i ran in to grab my camara and got a short video of it. it was floating slowly. it appeared to be a hot-air baloon, without the balloon. there was no sound, just a floating fireball. it was dark out, so a bright ball in the sky is not normal. i had to leave for work to get in on time, so i put the camara up and got in the car, intending to further watch the object, but it was gone. it doesn't show on the video because it was so dark, but it had tenticle like objects hanging from it, and reminded me of a jellyfish. i'm a cpa, and i don't believe in things i don't see, but this was something i've never seen before, so i'd like to know what it was!
content.summary: Egg-shaped fireball floating in indiana.

content.detailedDescription:
on july 4th, 2009 from approximately 10pm and 10:06pm, myself, my wife and my 11 year old son witnessed several orange balls of light in the sky. they were heading in a southeasterly direction towards the ocean at about 30 mph. they were a brilliant orange in color and were the size of a quarter at arms length. there was approximately 1000 feet between each of the orange ���balls���. there was a slight altitude difference between one ���ball��� and the next but the distance separating each ball was the same. they were all generally flying on the same flight path. they kept coming one after the other and we estimate between 6 and 8 of the orange ���balls���. i was able to snap 2 photos but no video because of a dead battery. 		
     after i had called my son and wife outside and they were able to see what i was seeing, i took my son with me in the car to try to get a closer look. as we were driving we saw the last one heading towards long island. i got out of my car and tried to get a photo but it was too late. before the last one was out of sight, it seemed to get 2 to 3 times brighter and then just shoot off. these orange balls were first sighted in my backyard in west haven, ct and we followed them about ��� mile to the west haven shore before they headed out towards long island. i watch the sky almost every night and have never seen anything like this before. my wife was actually a little upset after this incident. it was definately not fireworks or planes or helicopters, i���m absolutely sure. we just want to know what it was.
content.summary: Witnessed between 6-8 glowing orange "balls" in loose formation.

content.detailedDescription:
Video:
http://www.Youtube.Com/watch?V=ii9g-kvdzh0

description:
i was camping out behind my house with my 4 year old. we live in spartanburg county about 3 miles from the greenville/spartanburg airport. we were hanging out playing video games until about 10:30pm when we decided to turn in for the night.

as i was getting our blankets ready i looked up and through the mesh door of the tent which was facing to the west. through the mesh i saw an incredibly bright red light of considerable size moving slowly over the treeline. my first thought was that it might be an airplane, but i have lived in this area my entire life and i literally see planes come and go every night. this was like nothing i had ever seen and i immediately knew that it was not a plane. i fumbled around in the dark for my video camera, unzipped the door of the tent and was able to start filming the object about 20-30 seconds after it originally caught my eye. 

at first the bright red object continued slowly moving south, but then unexpectedly a much smaller white light emerged from the top and went upward at a fairly rapid pace. when the light was a good 2x higher from the ground than the red light, the red light quickly disappeared. the white light continued to stay in view and continued to move southward at a speed of perhaps 3x faster than the red light was traveling. after a bit it flickered and disappeared. when the red one disappeared, it just blinked off like a switch was flipped, but the white one flickered and faded more subtly.

i got the entire thing on tape, and the footage of the small object emerging from the larger object is quite good. my only regret is that i zoomed in to try to get a closer look, and some of the footage is rather jerky... serves me right for always making fun of people who don't seem to be able to hold a camera still while filming a ufo. still though, it's pretty exciting video. here's the link to the video on youtube: http://www.Youtube.Com/watch?V=ii9g-kvdzh0

i was very excited to see this. i've kept my eyes open for stuff before when i'm looking at the stars, but this was completely out of the blue and entirely unexpected. plus, i never carry my video camera with me, so the fact that my camera on hand is still amazing to me. 

skeptics may point out that:
1. this sighting took place very close to an airport
2. the sighting took place on july 3rd (fireworks) 

had i not seen the object myself for the duration that it was visible, and especially the emergence of the smaller white light, i too would have argued these as possibilities. however, the footage easily dismisses these arguments. it made no sound, and it moved unlike any fireworks i have ever seen. especially the way the white light sped up after separating from the red light. my 4 year old can be heard in the background trying to figure out what it was that we were seeing. he obviously didn't think it was fireworks, but he did say "maybe it's a rocket ship", which i found interesting. 

whatever it was, it was a blast being able to see it and film it.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Saw a large bright red ufo launch a small white ufo in greer, sc, july 3, 2009.

content.detailedDescription: My wife & i were enjoying our hot tub when i spotted an object heading west about 2,500 agl making no sound.  what make it stand out was it had no white collision light, just a red one.  in looking further we spotted a much dimmer red light at the front of the craft. we could barely see the outline but it looked oval or cigar-shaped.  straight and level flight a little slower than the jets which fly over.  we are located near an airway so it's easy to distinguish real airplanes from what we saw last night.
content.summary: Oval or cigar shape about 200 ft in length, red lights.

content.detailedDescription:
Around 4:30 in the morning i saw the backside of a rectangular shaped object as it passed over my apartment building . it was traveling east to west in a straight line and the height was between 150 to 300 feet . when it passed by or over the building i could hear a hum other than that there was no engine sounds or jet sounds . five bright white lights across the back side of it and a red light . it was strobing with some of the white lites doing a double flash , like blip blib every 10 secounds or so . the size was about 30 to 50 feet across the back side if not longer . i had it in sight for about a minute and a half untill it faded out of sight in the distance . 

i did a drawing on my pc of what i saw , sorry the drawing is crude i did it with my mouse . 

this is the fifth time since january that my girlfriend and i have seen something over the river here .
content.summary: Object over tennessee river.

content.detailedDescription:
Ps la verdad yo decidi enviar esta foto xq me la paso viendo esos programas de ovnis q pasan en history channel y en discovery channel y esta foto la tome en una zona arqueologica la chole en guerrero, mexico, cuando estaba arriba d una piedra tomando fotos con mi cel xq se veia muy bonito el paisaje, y la verdad yo no vi nada pero cuando abri la foto en la computadora se ve bien q es un ovni(xq ps se ve un disco cm los q salen en la tele) o tal vez sea un pajaro volando ps ahi uds. sacan sus concluciones.

ahi les dejo la foto.
hasta luego!!
content.summary: No vi nada solo abri la foto en la compu y aparecio eso.

content.detailedDescription: While sitting on our back deck watching fireworks in the area i first saw one reddish-orange sphere, appeared to be glowing or burning, at aprox. 300-500 feet above the ground, traveling silently south-southeast at estimated 20-30 mph. no change in altitude or direction; no sound.  followed about 8-10 seconds by another similar object...Same altitude, heading, speed.  seen during fireworks in neighborhood, but these were not fireworks, since they were moving at a consistant speed/altitude/direction.  i only saw 2 objects but a neighbor reported seeing 3 in succession.  i initially thought they could be fireworks, then i thought they could possibly be parachute flares drifting along in the wind, but they didn't change altitude (i'm unsure of what the wind direction/speed was at the time of the observation).  i was puzzled at what i saw, being an experienced aviation enthusiast/spotter.
content.summary: 2 reddish-orange spheres drifting over neighborhood.

content.detailedDescription: My husband, son and i were on our way home around 10:30 p.M. and we were watching fireworks in the sky when we saw something just floating in the sky.  it was in the west sky from us toward illinois (we live on the border of indiana/illinois).  it was actually beautiful.  it was low in the sky and if i had to guess i would say it was the size of a car. it looked like a gem - it was glowing amber/red and had flickers to it.  by the time we pulled in the driveway, it dimmed and just disappeared.   it was definitely not fireworks.  we all thought it was amazing.
content.summary: Amber/red glowing flickering west sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I come on this site from time to time because i find people's sightings fascinating.  i also reported a sighting once and found out it was a satellite.  however, i never stop believing in the possibility of life outside of our world.

anyhow...After a week or so of not checking the mufon site i came on here this morning and i started reading about everyone's sightings about an orange glowing sphere moving in the sky.  i couldn't believe what i was reading because i too saw this on the 4th of july.

i had just arrived at my friend's house just after 10pm to join them for a few beers and to light fireworks.  when i got there, i stood in front of the house, drank a beer and chatted with my friends and watching the elaborate fireworks in the sky (they bought those fancy fireworks from indiana which are illegal in illinois). well i just so happened to look up after a firework had exploded in the sky when i saw a flickering orange glowing object moving in a linear direction.  it looked almost like a chinese lantern.  as my friends continued chatting i would look up every couple of seconds and it was still there moving across the sky!  i tried to think nothing of it because i intially thought it was a lit amber from one of the lit firework, but it just kept floating in a linear direction (east to west) till i lost sight of it.  no one really noticed except for me because everyone was drinking beers or occupied with lighting firecrackers.  also, the sky was really cloudy and the atmosphere foggy so it resembled a burning amber in the sky. i kept staring at it because this "flame" never died out!

so when i come on here this morning and read that people saw this orange glowing light in other states, i can't help to think it was definitely a ufo. however, ever since i was told the last one was a satellite, i hope someone can tell me what this may have been.  the picture taken by the person in pewaukee is exactly what i saw except it was fuzzy because of the fog and clouds.  sorry no pictures because i honestly doubted what i saw...  :(
content.summary: Glowing orange light hovering in the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside w/my mom and younger brother watching the neighbors fireworks, when i saw a large, bright, ball that looked like fire to the south. i had no idea what is was and asked my mom. she didn't know either. we were 2 miles north of the city limits of helena,mt the capital city of montana.

the object was about 70 degrees above the horizon. the sky was clear and the moon almost full to the east. the object was much smaller than the moon, but much larger than a star or planet. the object moved very slow going north. then it did a round curve to the west. a layer of clouds moved in from the south below it. the object flickered twice, then the object vanished. i first saw it approximately 11:15pm it vanished at 11:18pm  i have no pictures or video unfortunately.
content.summary: Big, bright ball of red/orange.

content.detailedDescription:
Story: [pictures are in day-time just to give you a better view of what happened. no ufo pics]

i was on my front porch smoking a extremely disgusting cigarette.  so, to save myself i was going to go down to my sisters truck to grab a marb. as i was going down the stairs i flicked my lighter a few times until it lit.  as it was lit for about 2 or 3 seconds these lights shown through the trees (picture 1: the lights were to the right of the opening [on the left side of the pic] in the trees shining through) i would say there was about 3 or 4 lights.  i stood there watching anxiously, and adrenaline pumping throughout my body.

it moved after about 2 or 3 seconds into the clearing (picture 2) in a medium speed.  what really blew my mind was how quiet it was for being so close.  there was no noise at all, all i could hear was my fast breathing and heavily beating heart.  as i watched it moved above the trees behind my shed, and it shone through them.  the light was bright enough to illuminate the trees but not the ground.  i couldn't tell what kind of shape this was all in all because the lights were hiding it.  i was shocked.. scared.. and shaking.  and for a big dude like me, its hard to scare.  i ran up the stairs and into the house and told my mom.. she didn't believe me and her first reaction was, "what did you smoke now?"

i wasn't under the influence of anything.  i was shooken and kept having these chills go up my back throughout the hour after.  

the only reason i could give for seeing this event would probably be when i was at my cousins house about four weeks ago.  he is into this ufo crap, and hes encountered something really weird, but i won't get into that.  we were sitting on the backporch watching the sky and he told me you tell them with your mind that you want to see them and they will eventually come.  i didn't believe him.  but i tried it, and i really wanted to see one though.  well low and behold 4 weeks later i'm typing on mufon about a ufo report.  

i'm going to keep trying to see them everynight now.  and i have more of a respect for the unknown.  with the lunar eclipse coming tomorrow and the crop circles they produce warning/teaching us of how to predict astronomical events, i have nothing to be afraid of.  they're trying to help us, as far as i know.

but, all in all this was the most freakish and bizarre thing i have ever seen......

it was silent and bright.  

i just want to know 1.Why they were at my house (because the "calling the aliens" thing probably didn't do anything).  2. why did they leave when they saw the lighter (obviously they're intelligent) and 3. do they have something to do with my sisters time warp?

about a month and a half ago.. my sister was woken up by her dog at about 2 am i think she said, and she took him outside to pee.  an hour later she woke up in the bathroom with the dog.  and she is the lightest sleeper, and she has never slept walked.  i mean i live in a pretty wilderness environment, could this just be a good place for the unknown to dwell at night?  i don't know.  i hope someone contacts me.

thank you,
cody
content.summary: Bizarre, bone-chilling, and gave me goosebumps...

content.detailedDescription: On july 3rd 2009 i was staying with a friend's family on lake erie.  i was inside getting something to eat when everyone on the patio started yelling for me to come outside.  (i have a science background and work in a related field)  i ran outside to see a bright red fireball coming from the nortwest horizon and moving southeast.  following the fireball was a second fireball approximately 4 seconds behind.  we (8 witnesses) followed the path as long at it stayed in site (approx. 20-30 seconds)  the object was very bright but it's altitude and speed were very difficult to gauge.  at 10:12pm a third red fireball moved across the sky, slightly less bright and further away than the previous two.  it came from a direction further west than the first two.  these objects did not streak across the sky and appeared to be burning or shooting flames.  my first thought when i saw the objects was that we were witnessing missiles being launched.  as i watched these objects i kept hoping they would continue to move across the sky and not crash to the earth.  the first two objects disappeared behind the houses and the third one behind a cloud.
content.summary: 3 red fireballs moving extremely fast.

content.detailedDescription:
2009-06-08   eight foot suspended silver sphere @ 60 feet 


it���s monday, june 8, 2009 @ 6:00 am in the morning and i���m seeing my better-half off on her six-o���clock departure for work. i then go back to the kitchen to get my second cup of coffee and return outside to the balcony. i sat the cup down and proceeded to light a smoke, and i simultaneously looked up and saw a large 8��� bubble or sphere hanging suspended above and behind the pine trees in front of me. it must have been as close as fifty or sixty feet, and it looked to be maybe 35 feet high in the air���just hanging there. 

my first thought was��� who else is seeing this thing. i couldn���t do anything but just sit there. i truly felt like a ���deer in the headlights.���  i was almost too shocked to react. i was amazed at how i could see the pine tree branches reflecting on the surface of this thing. it looked like an 8 ft. version of a silver garden wishing ball. i remember thinking that if i move���  this thing will probably take off. i could feel my heart pounding, but it was almost a mesmerizing and fearful feeling to just look at this thing. there was no recollection of noises during this event, and i don���t recall much other than being confounded by it���s abrupt appearance.

anyway, i last remember seeing it start to rise up and past the top of the overhang. i didn���t get up to follow it path upward���.I just sat there. later, i remember thinking how atypical this was of my normal reaction to any chance at such an event. i���m not even sure how long i sat there afterwards thinking about it. i was really shocked that it was just suddenly there, because kim and i both were there just minutes earlier. then i got up��� went inside��� looked at the stove-clock and it said 8:45 am. i took a shower and busied myself trying not to think about what happened, but i just couldn���t stop thinking about it��� all day. i firmly believe that my action of late night vigils, along with instigating  some form of interaction ���may be the cause of this encounter.

if anyone has seen this object or anything similar...Please contact me thru mufon!


gary mansfield, fi 
nashville, tn
content.summary: Eight foot suspended silver sphere @ 60 feet.

content.detailedDescription: My mom had told me that there was a strange yellowish light flashing and pulsating in our window so we ran out to see where this light was coming from and we couldn't find nothing on what would be transmitting this strange light so my mom said it's most likely nothing more then a car light reflection. well then i thought to my self it's a nice warm night i'm going to take a walk down the street to visit a friend because i know he would be up late as i started walking i felt like i was being fallowed as strange as it seem i looked up in to the sky and noticed star like orb the very one that i have been seeing now for quite some time since the summer of 2008 as i would look up into the night sky i would see it moving really slowly and then stopping and becoming dim like as if it didn't want me to see it so as i started walking a little more this star like object or orb would brighten up and fallow me more i ran to my friend's house and knocked on his screen door and as he came out the door the star like orb disappeared if any one would like to question me on this please contact me at wright10301973@gmail.Com i now know for sure that it was no satellite in fact this orb also turned as i was watching it and had no noise to it what so ever at first i thought maybe my eye's are playing tricks on me but i watched it long enough that it was moving and it was no satellite i'm writing this statement out of all god's honest truth of what i seen just hope not to get abducted after this experience
content.summary: Ufo star like object fallowed me for like a block away from my house !

content.detailedDescription:
Back in sept. 24th or 25th 2002 around noon(i know the date because i looked up the bill i submitted for that job) i was working on a chimney for a client east of waupun, wi. i was on the roof and was tuckpointing and so i was looking up at the top of the chimney. out of the corner of my eye i noticed some movement. i turned my attention to the movement and saw something strange. i saw two (2) orbs way up there in the sky. they were moving in a straight line south to north. these objects were so high that if i didn't concentrate my focus on them i would lose site of them. they traveled across the sky weaving in and out of each other. i got the impression that they were enjoying this weaving around each other. from what i could tell they were silver or chrome colored orbs moving fast at perhaps way over 10,000 ft., maybe 20,000 or more. it took them about 2 minutes to go across 25% of the sky and then they were so far away that i could no longer see them. my estimate of there size is approximately 10 to 15 feet in diameter.

had i not been looking up at that time i would have missed them. i'm pretty sure no one else could have seen them that day because they were difficult to see and you would need to be looking in the precise area of the sky at that precise time. i checked the jet stream that day when i got home. it was west to east that day in wisconsin. these things were traveling south to north. they're movements were similar to what i would call intelligently controlled (weaving)silver balloons floating high in the jet stream. after that day i was no longer a skeptic about ufo's. i think of that day often and wonder.

i've told a few people close to me about the experience but it's like you had to be there to get the full effect.

i personally felt like it was not one of ours.
content.summary: Two orbs weaving as they traversed the sky in broad daylight.
